subwords: adj	Free of flaws or imperfections; unsullied.
n	(archaic or dialectal) Sorrow; repentance; regret.
adj	(rare, nonstandard) Belonging to per, their (singular). Gender-neutral third-person singular possessive adjective, coordinate with gendered his and her.
n	(rail transport) The station code of Prince Edward in Hong Kong.
n	(uncountable) A distilled spirit derived from fermented cane sugar and molasses.
n	(computing) A remark (programming language statement used for documentation).
v	(informal) To represent; to act as a representative for.
n	A country in South America. Official name: Republic of Peru. Capital and largest city: Lima.

n	(UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, South Africa) A public house where beverages, primarily alcoholic, may be bought and consumed, also providing food and sometimes entertainment such as live music or television.
n	(rail transport) The station code of Royapuram railway station in India.
n	An animal of the family Felidae:
n	(New Zealand politics) ACT New Zealand, a liberal conservative political party in New Zealand
n	(countable) An outer garment covering the upper torso and arms.ᵂᵖ
n	(by extension) The art or skill of doing something in harmony with the essential nature of the thing.
n	Abbreviation of October. [The tenth month of the Gregorian calendar, following September and preceding November. Abbreviation: Oct.]
